name: Remorhaz
lore: Remorhazes are enormous, centipede-like predators that generate tremendous internal heat. Found in the most frigid arctic environments, these burrowing monstrosities tunnel through glaciers and frozen earth to ambush prey. The searing heat within their bodies is so intense that it can melt weapons and burn creatures that strike them in melee. Despite their terrifying power, remorhazes are driven primarily by hunger, attacking anything they perceive as food. Treasures from consumed victims can sometimes be found in a remorhaz's gizzard or lair.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.description: A creature that hits the remorhaz with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 10 ft. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition, and the remorhaz can't Bite another target.

hit.additionalEffects: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition, and the remorhaz can't Bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 5 ft. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature currently Grappled by the remorhaz. A swallowed creature has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and takes 21 (6d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns. If the remorhaz takes 30 or more damage in a single turn from a swallowed creature, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which lands in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz with the Prone condition. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting with the Prone condition.

attack.targets: one Medium or smaller creature Grappled by the remorhaz
